stem: Carpal tunnel syndrome typically presents first with which pattern?

choices.A: Thenar weakness with no sensory symptoms
choices.B: Sensory deficits in median distribution, thenar weakness later
choices.C: Loss of elbow extension and posterior arm numbness
choices.E: Isolated dorsal hand numbness with normal motor function

rationale_correct: CTS classically begins with paresthesias/pain in the median distribution; thenar weakness/atrophy develops with progression.

rationale_distractors.A: Pure motor onset is atypical for CTS.
rationale_distractors.C: Posterior arm findings suggest proximal radial/axillary involvement.
rationale_distractors.D: Radial deviation on flexion suggests ulnar nerve/FCU involvement.
rationale_distractors.E: Dorsal hand sensory loss suggests radial superficial branch injury.

evidence.citation: Selski D. Nerve Injuries of the Upper Limb (Slides). 2022.
